The Buddha said:
Pure Wisdom!

If the Buddha is in the world, sentient beings give rise to pure thoughts. After the Buddha's nirvana, it should also be like this. Do not give rise to the thought of emptiness or existence. Be thirsty for wholesome dharmas and do not become weary. Why is this?

Good sons!

If you wish to bathe the image, you should use cow's head sandalwood, purple sandalwood, tamalapatra, sweet-scented root, angelica, white sandalwood, saffron, camphor, agarwood, musk, cloves, and other such wonderful fragrances, according to what you can obtain. Place them in a clean vessel, first make a square altar, set up a wonderful bed seat, and place the Buddha on it.
Use the various fragrant waters to bathe it in order.
After using the various fragrant waters all around, again rinse with clean water.
Those who bathe the image should each take a little of the water used to bathe the image and place it on their own heads, burning various incenses as offerings.
First, when pouring water on the image, you should recite the following verse:

When burning incense, one should recite this verse:
The fragrance of precepts, concentration, wisdom, liberation, and the knowledge and insight of liberation, pervades the ten directions, always fragrant;
May this incense smoke be like this, transforming into the five kinds of bodies for oneself and others.

At that time, after the World-Honored One had spoken this Dharma, in the assembly there were innumerable Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas who attained the pure and stainless samadhi. They immediately rose from their seats;

This sutra is called 'Washing the Buddhas and Attaining Purity of the Body.' It should be upheld in this way.
After having spoken this sutra, the entire assembly greatly rejoiced, and with faith and understanding they upheld and practiced it.
